original: Blom, Torsten Helmer, provinsialläkare, Klintehamn, f. 20/8/97 i Värnamo av folksk :lär. Frans B. o. Hildur Hydén. G. 28 m. Ann-Mari Sundberg. Barn: Carl OM f. 30, Hans Torsten 39. — Stud:ex. i Gävle 16, med. kand. i Upps. 23 o. med. lic. där 27. Assist :läk. v. Gävle las. 26, v. Torsby las. 27-28, läk. v. Sillegårds brunn somm. 28, und :läk. v. Hässleby sanat. 28-30, kort. förordn. s. prov:-läk. i Älvkarleö, Haparanda, Molkoms o. Malsjö distr. 27-28, i Storviks distr. 29-33, prakt. läk. i Storvik 30, kö-pingsläk. där 31, järnv:läk. 37, prov:-läk. i Klintehamns distr. sed. 44.
translated: Blom, Torsten Helmer, district medical officer, Klintehamn, b. 20/8/97 in Värnamo to elementary school teacher Frans B. and Hildur Hydén. Married in 1928 to Ann-Mari Sundberg. Children: Carl OM (b. 1930) and Hans Torsten (b. 1939). He graduated from high school in Gävle in 1916, received his Bachelor of Medicine from Uppsala University in 1923, and his medical license there in 1927. He worked as an assistant physician at Gävle hospital in 1926, at Torsby hospital in 1927-28, as a physician at Sillegårdsbrunn in summer 1928, and as a junior physician at Hässleby Sanatorium in 1928-30. He had temporary appointments as district medical officer in Älvkarleö, Haparanda, Molkoms, and Malsjö districts in 1927-28, and in Storviks district in 1929-33. He was a practicing physician in Storvik in 1930, chief physician there in 1931, railway physician in 1937, and district medical officer in Klintehamn district since 1944.
